title.narrative: Emergency support with immediate impact on agricultural livelihoods for people living in urban and suburban areas in Guantanamo provinces

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to assist those suffering from direct and immediate impact on the livelihoods of affected people in order to enable them to return to their normal lives as soon as possible and alleviate their difficulties caused by the hurricane. FAO will support families that produce food in 1178 Sub urban farms; productive family gardens; semi protected organoponia and organoponics units with inputs needed. In order to meet local food requirements in a short period, supplies and equipment will be provided to enable short term harvesting within the time framework of 60 days. The target is 156,958 affected people.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
